result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy A. Sadowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Bond applied  -  Balance still to be collected
***JOC IS AMENDED TO SHOW COURT COSTS ARE PAID IN FULL ***

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Counseling shall specifically include:  Anger management / DV counseling,   AODA Assessment and follow through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  
*  Pay fine  and court costs including all applicable surcharges totaling $2955.   
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State. Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney R Ogren. Clerk/H. Barnett. Court imposes a total sentence of 4 years WSP:  2 years initial confinement w/credit for 258 days served; 2 years extended supervision w/conditions; deft is eligible for CIP/SAP; $2,955.00 total fine/costs (including IID surcharge, $250 DNA sample, $328 prosecution costs and $50 safe ride program surcharge), bond applied, deft to submit DNA sample; 36 month revocation of DL; IID; OWI assessment.
